[SYNTAX]: Awkward phrasing in "My wife, who has been married long enough to feel deeply gratified..." (wordy but not incorrect)
[LEXICON]: Uncommon term "dernier cri" used without explanation (may confuse some readers)
[PUNCTUATION]: Excessive use of em-dashes in dialogue ("I coughed and answered evasively:--")
Inconsistent use of quotation marks with em-dashes ("Alight here," he announced facetiously, "for 'Ome for Lost Dawgs!'")

[TRANSITION]: Sudden shift from discussing dog breeds to the Battersea tram journey feels abrupt
[LOGIC]: Slight inconsistency in timeline (deciding to go to the Home for Lost Dogs after discussing pedigrees)
[CLARITY]: Confusing reference to "Isle of Dogs" and "Barking Reach" without clear contextual explanation
[STRUCTURE]: Sudden introduction of the tracking scene feels disconnected from previous dialogue

[SYNTAX]: Slight comma splice in "Our man was nowhere to be seen and the street was almost empty" (missing conjunction)

[LOGIC]: Sudden shift to discussing the Dogs' Home at the end feels abrupt after chase sequence
